```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(flexdashboard)
library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
```


<!--
Steps for adding reactivity to flexdashboard:

1. add runtime: shiny to YAML
    a. Note how the Knit button changes to Run document after you Save
2. add a sidebar to dashboard for shiny inputs
3. add shiny input(s)
4. wrap the plot you want to add reactivity to within a render function. 
    a. Don't forget to use ({ }) for multiple lines
5. adjust the data within the plot code with the correct input ID
-->

Column {.sidebar}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
### Sidebar

We are adding reactivity here
```{r}
shiny::selectInput(inputId = "pp_species", label = "Select a penguin species:",
                   choices = c(unique(palmerpenguins::penguins$species)),
                   selected = palmerpenguins::penguins$species[[1]])
```



Column {data-width=650}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Penguin Scatterplot

```{r}
shiny::renderPlot({
    ggplot(data = penguins %>% 
               filter(species == input$pp_species),
       aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g)) +
    geom_point(aes(color = species)) +
    scale_color_manual(values = c(
        "Adelie" = "purple2",
        "Chinstrap" = "orange",
        "Gentoo" = "cyan4"
    )) +
    labs(
        title = NULL,
        x = "Flipper Length (mm)",
        y = "Body Mass (g)",
        color = "Species"
    ) +
    theme_minimal()
})
```

Column {data-width=350}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

### Bill Depth Distribution of Chinstrap

```{r}
penguins %>%
    filter(species == "Chinstrap") %>%
    ggplot(aes(x = bill_depth_mm)) +
    geom_histogram(fill = "orange") +
    labs(title = NULL,
         x = "Bill Depth (mm)",
         y = NULL) +
    theme_minimal()
```

### Penguin Species on Biscoe

```{r}
# subsetted penguins data frame
biscoe_sp <- penguins %>% 
    filter(island == "Biscoe") %>% 
    group_by(species) %>% 
    summarize(count = n())
    
# bar plot 
ggplot(data = biscoe_sp, aes(x = species, y = count)) +
    geom_col(aes(fill = species)) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c(
        "Adelie" = "purple2",
        "Gentoo" = "cyan4"
    )) +
    labs(title = NULL,
         x = NULL,
         y = "Number of species",
         fill = "Species") +
    theme_minimal() 
```
